“Return” of the ruble: German media announced the strengthening of the Russian currency

02 Nov 2019, 16:24

“Return” of the ruble: German media announced the strengthening of the Russian currency
16:24 11/02/2019 Photo: pixabay.com0
The international rating agency Fitch previously assigned Russia an investment rating, like that of China and India, - BBB.


German media reported on the "return" of the ruble

In Russia, the financial situation is improving, and the ruble remains stable regardless of political news. This conclusion was reached by the author of the article entitled “After the sanctions and the shock from oil prices: this is why the ruble returns”, published in the German publication Focus. As noted in the material, after the fall caused by Western sanctions and lower oil prices, the ruble managed to significantly strengthen against the dollar and the euro and become one of the strongest currencies of developing countries in 2019. The decline in yields in Europe and the US is forcing new investors to invest more in Russian currency, and it turned out that the demand for it is very high, the author writes. The article also mentions that from the point of view of international investors, Russian government bonds are a reliable investment tool.
The international rating agency Fitch previously assigned Russia an investment rating, like that of China and India, - BBB. At the same time, Forbes notes, Moscow tightly controls expenditures - the debt to GDP ratio is only about 20 percent, and 124.14 billion dollars (almost seven percent of GDP) are in the National Welfare Fund. Even more funds - in the international reserves of the Central Bank. Analysts of the Swiss bank UBS, in turn, described the Russian currency as "very interesting for investment." This was facilitated by good fundamental economic indicators - low inflation, excellent balance of payments, large gold and foreign exchange reserves, formed due to the budget rule.
Source: RIA Novosti
